table.name: access_keys
table.remarks: Access keys are used to provide pseudo-login functionality for security-minimal tasks. Passkeys can be emailed directly to users, who can use them for a limited time in lieu of standard username and password.

table.name: announcement_settings
table.remarks: More data about announcements, including localized properties like names and contents.

table.name: announcement_type_settings
table.remarks: More data about announcement types, including localized properties like their names.

table.name: announcement_types
table.remarks: Announcement types allow for announcements to optionally be categorized.

table.name: announcements
table.remarks: Announcements are messages that can be presented to users e.g. on the homepage.

table.name: author_settings
table.remarks: More data about authors, including localized properties such as their name and affiliation.

table.name: authors
table.remarks: The authors of a publication.

table.name: categories
table.remarks: Categories permit the organization of submissions into a heirarchical structure.

table.name: category_settings
table.remarks: More data about categories, including localized properties such as names.

table.name: citation_settings
table.remarks: Additional data about citations, including localized content.

table.name: citations
table.remarks: A citation made by an associated publication.

table.name: completed_payments
table.remarks: A list of completed (fulfilled) payments relating to a payment type such as a subscription payment.

table.name: controlled_vocab_entries
table.remarks: The order that a word or phrase used in a controlled vocabulary should appear. For example, the order of keywords in a publication.

table.name: controlled_vocab_entry_settings
table.remarks: More data about a controlled vocabulary entry, including localized properties such as the actual word or phrase.

table.name: controlled_vocabs
table.remarks: Every word or phrase used in a controlled vocabulary. Controlled vocabularies are used for submission metadata like keywords and subjects, reviewer interests, and wherever a similar dictionary of words or phrases is required. Each entry corresponds to a word or phrase like "cellular reproduction" and a type like "submissionKeyword".

table.name: custom_issue_orders
table.remarks: Ordering information for the issue list, when custom issue ordering is specified.

table.name: custom_section_orders
table.remarks: Ordering information for sections within issues, when issue-specific section ordering is specified.

table.name: data_object_tombstone_oai_set_objects
table.remarks: Relationships between tombstones and other data that can be collected in OAI sets, e.g. sections.

table.name: data_object_tombstone_settings
table.remarks: More data about data object tombstones, including localized content.

table.name: data_object_tombstones
table.remarks: Entries for published data that has been removed. Usually used in the OAI endpoint.

table.name: doi_settings
table.remarks: More data about DOIs, including the registration agency.

table.name: dois
table.remarks: Stores all DOIs used in the system.

table.name: edit_decisions
table.remarks: Editorial decisions recorded on a submission, such as decisions to accept or decline the submission, as well as decisions to send for review, send to copyediting, request revisions, and more.

table.name: email_log
table.remarks: A record of email messages that are sent in relation to an associated entity, such as a submission.

table.name: email_log_users
table.remarks: A record of users associated with an email log entry.

table.name: email_templates
table.remarks: Custom email templates created by each context, and overrides of the default templates.

column.name: email_key
column.remarks: Unique identifier for this email.

table.name: email_templates_default_data
table.remarks: Default email templates created for every installed locale.

column.name: email_key
column.remarks: Unique identifier for this email.

table.name: email_templates_settings
table.remarks: More data about custom email templates, including localized properties such as the subject and body.

table.name: event_log
table.remarks: A log of all events related to an object like a submission.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: NULL if it's system or automated event

table.name: event_log_settings
table.remarks: Data about an event log entry. This data is commonly used to display information about an event to a user.

table.name: failed_jobs
table.remarks: A log of all failed jobs.

table.name: files
table.remarks: Records information in the database about files tracked by the system, linking them to the local filesystem.

table.name: filter_groups
table.remarks: Filter groups are used to organized filters into named sets, which can be retrieved by the application for invocation.

table.name: filter_settings
table.remarks: More data about filters, including localized content.

table.name: filters
table.remarks: Filters represent a transformation of a supported piece of data from one form to another, such as a PHP object into an XML document.

table.name: genre_settings
table.remarks: More data about file genres, including localized properties such as the genre name.

table.name: genres
table.remarks: The types of submission files configured for each context, such as Article Text, Data Set, Transcript, etc.

column.name: required
column.remarks: Whether or not at least one file of this genre is required for a new submission.

table.name: institution_ip
table.remarks: Records IP address ranges and associates them with institutions.

table.name: institution_settings
table.remarks: More data about institutions, including localized properties like names.

table.name: institutional_subscriptions
table.remarks: A list of institutional subscriptions, linking a subscription with an institution.

table.name: institutions
table.remarks: Institutions for statistics and subscriptions.

column.name: ror
column.remarks: ROR (Research Organization Registry) ID

table.name: issue_files
table.remarks: Relationships between issues and issue files, such as cover images.

table.name: issue_galley_settings
table.remarks: More data about issue galleys, including localized content such as labels.

table.name: issue_galleys
table.remarks: Issue galleys are representations of the entire issue in a single file, such as a complete issue PDF.

table.name: issue_settings
table.remarks: More data about issues, including localized properties such as issue titles.

table.name: issues
table.remarks: A list of all journal issues, with identifying information like year, number, volume, etc.

table.name: job_batches
table.remarks: Job batches allow jobs to be collected into groups for managed processing.

table.name: jobs
table.remarks: All pending or in-progress jobs.

table.name: journal_settings
table.remarks: More data about journals, including localized properties like policies.

table.name: journals
table.remarks: A list of all journals in the installation of OJS.

column.name: seq
column.remarks: Used to order lists of journals

column.name: enabled
column.remarks: Controls whether or not the journal is considered "live" and will appear on the website. (Note that disabled journals may still be accessible, but only if the user knows the URL.)

table.name: library_file_settings
table.remarks: More data about library files, including localized content such as names.

table.name: library_files
table.remarks: Library files can be associated with the context (press/server/journal) or with individual submissions, and are typically forms, agreements, and other administrative documents that are not part of the scholarly content.

table.name: metrics_context
table.remarks: Daily statistics for views of the homepage.

table.name: metrics_counter_submission_daily
table.remarks: Daily statistics matching the COUNTER R5 protocol for views and downloads of published submissions and galleys.

table.name: metrics_counter_submission_institution_daily
table.remarks: Daily statistics matching the COUNTER R5 protocol for views and downloads from institutions.

table.name: metrics_counter_submission_institution_monthly
table.remarks: Monthly statistics matching the COUNTER R5 protocol for views and downloads from institutions.

table.name: metrics_counter_submission_monthly
table.remarks: Monthly statistics matching the COUNTER R5 protocol for views and downloads of published submissions and galleys.

table.name: metrics_issue
table.remarks: Daily statistics for views and downloads of published issues.

table.name: metrics_submission
table.remarks: Daily statistics for views and downloads of published submissions and galleys.

table.name: metrics_submission_geo_daily
table.remarks: Daily statistics by country, region and city for views and downloads of published submissions and galleys.

table.name: metrics_submission_geo_monthly
table.remarks: Monthly statistics by country, region and city for views and downloads of published submissions and galleys.

table.name: navigation_menu_item_assignment_settings
table.remarks: More data about navigation menu item assignments to navigation menus, including localized content.

table.name: navigation_menu_item_assignments
table.remarks: Links navigation menu items to navigation menus.

table.name: navigation_menu_item_settings
table.remarks: More data about navigation menu items, including localized content such as names.

table.name: navigation_menu_items
table.remarks: Navigation menu items are single elements within a navigation menu.

table.name: navigation_menus
table.remarks: Navigation menus on the website are installed with the software as a default set, and can be customized.

table.name: notes
table.remarks: Notes allow users to annotate associated entities, such as submissions.

table.name: notification_settings
table.remarks: More data about notifications, including localized properties.

table.name: notification_subscription_settings
table.remarks: Which email notifications a user has chosen to unsubscribe from.

table.name: notifications
table.remarks: User notifications created during certain operations.

table.name: oai_resumption_tokens
table.remarks: OAI resumption tokens are used to allow for pagination of large result sets into manageable pieces.

table.name: plugin_settings
table.remarks: More data about plugins, including localized properties. This table is frequently used to store plugin-specific configuration.

table.name: publication_categories
table.remarks: Associates publications (and thus submissions) with categories.

table.name: publication_galley_settings
table.remarks: More data about publication galleys, including localized content such as labels.

table.name: publication_galleys
table.remarks: Publication galleys are representations of a publication in a specific format, e.g. a PDF.

table.name: publication_settings
table.remarks: More data about publications, including localized properties such as the title and abstract.

table.name: publications
table.remarks: Each publication is one version of a submission.

table.name: queries
table.remarks: Discussions, usually related to a submission, created by editors, authors and other editorial staff.

table.name: query_participants
table.remarks: The users assigned to a discussion.

table.name: queued_payments
table.remarks: Unfulfilled (queued) payments, i.e. payments that have not yet been completed via an online payment system.

table.name: review_assignments
table.remarks: Data about peer review assignments for all submissions.

table.name: review_files
table.remarks: A list of the submission files made available to each assigned reviewer.

table.name: review_form_element_settings
table.remarks: More data about review form elements, including localized content such as question text.

table.name: review_form_elements
table.remarks: Each review form element represents a single question on a review form.

table.name: review_form_responses
table.remarks: Each review form response records a reviewer's answer to a review form element associated with a peer review.

table.name: review_form_settings
table.remarks: More data about review forms, including localized content such as names.

table.name: review_forms
table.remarks: Review forms provide custom templates for peer reviews with several types of questions.

table.name: review_round_files
table.remarks: Records the files made available to reviewers for a round of reviews. These can be further customized on a per review basis with review_files.

table.name: review_rounds
table.remarks: Peer review assignments are organized into multiple rounds on a submission.

table.name: scheduled_tasks
table.remarks: The last time each scheduled task was run.

table.name: section_settings
table.remarks: More data about sections, including localized properties like section titles.

table.name: sections
table.remarks: A list of all sections into which submissions can be organized, forming the table of contents.

table.name: sessions
table.remarks: Session data for logged-in users.

table.name: site
table.remarks: A singleton table describing basic information about the site.

column.name: redirect
column.remarks: If not 0, redirect to the specified journal/conference/... site.

column.name: primary_locale
column.remarks: Primary locale for the site.

column.name: installed_locales
column.remarks: Locales for which support has been installed.

column.name: supported_locales
column.remarks: Locales supported by the site (for hosted journals/conferences/...).

table.name: site_settings
table.remarks: More data about the site, including localized properties such as its name.

table.name: stage_assignments
table.remarks: Who can access a submission while it is in the editorial workflow. Includes all editorial and author assignments. For reviewers, see review_assignments.

table.name: subeditor_submission_group
table.remarks: Subeditor assignments to e.g. sections and categories

table.name: submission_comments
table.remarks: Comments on a submission, e.g. peer review comments

table.name: submission_file_revisions
table.remarks: Revisions map submission_file entries to files on the data store.

table.name: submission_file_settings
table.remarks: Localized data about submission files like published metadata.

table.name: submission_files
table.remarks: All files associated with a submission, such as those uploaded during submission, as revisions, or by copyeditors or layout editors for production.

table.name: submission_search_keyword_list
table.remarks: A list of all keywords used in the search index

table.name: submission_search_object_keywords
table.remarks: Relationships between search objects and keywords in the search index

column.name: pos
column.remarks: Word position of the keyword in the object.

table.name: submission_search_objects
table.remarks: A list of all search objects indexed in the search index

column.name: type
column.remarks: Type of item. E.g., abstract, fulltext, etc.

column.name: assoc_id
column.remarks: Optional ID of an associated record (e.g., a file_id)

table.name: submission_settings
table.remarks: Localized data about submissions

table.name: submissions
table.remarks: All submissions submitted to the context, including incomplete, declined and unpublished submissions.

table.name: subscription_type_settings
table.remarks: More data about subscription types, including localized properties such as names.

table.name: subscription_types
table.remarks: Subscription types represent the kinds of subscriptions that a user or institution may have, such as an annual subscription or a discounted subscription.

table.name: subscriptions
table.remarks: A list of subscriptions, both institutional and individual, for journals that use subscription-based publishing.

table.name: temporary_files
table.remarks: Temporary files, e.g. where files are kept during an upload process before they are moved somewhere more appropriate.

table.name: usage_stats_institution_temporary_records
table.remarks: Temporary stats for views and downloads from institutions based on visitor log records. Data in this table is provisional. See the metrics_* tables for compiled stats.

table.name: usage_stats_total_temporary_records
table.remarks: Temporary stats totals based on visitor log records. Data in this table is provisional. See the metrics_* tables for compiled stats.

table.name: usage_stats_unique_item_investigations_temporary_records
table.remarks: Temporary stats on unique downloads based on visitor log records. Data in this table is provisional. See the metrics_* tables for compiled stats.

table.name: usage_stats_unique_item_requests_temporary_records
table.remarks: Temporary stats on unique views based on visitor log records. Data in this table is provisional. See the metrics_* tables for compiled stats.

table.name: user_group_settings
table.remarks: More data about user groups, including localized properties such as the name.

table.name: user_group_stage
table.remarks: Which stages of the editorial workflow the user_groups can access.

table.name: user_groups
table.remarks: All defined user roles in a context, such as Author, Reviewer, Section Editor and Journal Manager.

table.name: user_interests
table.remarks: Associates users with user interests (which are stored in the controlled vocabulary tables).

table.name: user_settings
table.remarks: More data about users, including localized properties like their name and affiliation.

table.name: user_user_groups
table.remarks: Maps users to their assigned user_groups.

table.name: users
table.remarks: All registered users, including authentication data and profile data.

table.name: versions
table.remarks: Describes the installation and upgrade version history for the application and all installed plugins.

column.name: major
column.remarks: Major component of version number, e.g. the 2 in OJS 2.3.8-0

column.name: minor
column.remarks: Minor component of version number, e.g. the 3 in OJS 2.3.8-0

column.name: revision
column.remarks: Revision component of version number, e.g. the 8 in OJS 2.3.8-0

column.name: build
column.remarks: Build component of version number, e.g. the 0 in OJS 2.3.8-0

column.name: current
column.remarks: 1 iff the version entry being described is currently active. This permits the table to store past installation history for forensic purposes.

column.name: product_type
column.remarks: Describes the type of product this row describes, e.g. "plugins.generic" (for a generic plugin) or "core" for the application itself

column.name: product
column.remarks: Uniquely identifies the product this version row describes, e.g. "ojs2" for OJS 2.x, "languageToggle" for the language toggle block plugin, etc.

column.name: product_class_name
column.remarks: Specifies the class name associated with this product, for plugins, or the empty string where not applicable.

column.name: lazy_load
column.remarks: 1 iff the row describes a lazy-load plugin; 0 otherwise

column.name: sitewide
column.remarks: 1 iff the row describes a site-wide plugin; 0 otherwise
